Title: the prom equivalency

Leonard: Oh, hey, oh, we ran into your mom at Benihana last night.
I know you-you don’t want to hear it, but she was there with Stuart.
Don’t rule out the dating.
But the gibbon doesn’t know what it’s categorized as. It doesn’t even know it’s called a gibbon.
Hey, where’s Bernadette?
Let me guess, you think the whole idea is lame?
Hmm, to be honest, it’s kind of a dream come true to go to even a fake prom with a woman as beautiful as you.
What?
You know, if you’re not gonna learn how to do this, they make some pretty good clip-ons.
Bruce Wayne doesn’t make his roommate tie it for him.
There, perfect.
I thought you were gonna pretend to be an alien.
Was that a flask?
You’re gonna put alcohol in the punch?
If you had ripped jeans and a leather jacket, you’d be like the toughest kid on the Disney Channel. So, anything else planned for tonight?
And while you’re at it, I know that at this age your hormones are raging, but just because all your friends are having sex doesn’t mean you have to.
You know, ’cause, ’cause a lot of people lose their virginity on prom night.
Just relax, it’s a joke. You don’t have hormones.
Wow, you look amazing.
Oh, it’s a scaly genital organ that grows between his shoulder blades. Try not to touch it when you’re dancing.
He’s right, I was thinking of the lower flermin.
Oh, the girls really did a nice job.
What makes you think I didn’t go to my prom? I went.
I took a little lady I like to call loneliness.
Oh, it’s all right. We ended up having a threesome with her friend humiliation, so…
No, you wouldn’t have.
It was before my growth spurt.
Very funny.
I would have asked you. In my head. On the way home. While I was having a good cry.
There’s no music.
My God, who’s the dork now? Thank you for wearing your flats.
Look at me. Dancing with the prettiest girl at the prom.
I sent them a bikini shot of you years ago. This is nice. I kind of wish no one else was coming.
Howard: Oh, yeah, she loves that place. Every time they flip a shrimp in the air, she practically leaps out of her seat to catch it. That’s why I don’t take her to SeaWorld.
That’s fine. I don’t care.
They’re not dating. They’re just two friends who went out to dinner.
Hey, lots of people wear matching pajamas who aren’t dating.
Like you and your dog.
Fine, it bothers me. You happy?
How is this helpful?
Hey.
She and Amy are out dress shopping for their prom thing.
Bernie’s really excited. I could tell because her voice got so high, the beagle next door started howling.
Yep.
You know exactly who it is. He’s gonna bring my mom. Why did you even invite him?
I didn’t take her, she was a chaperone.
What was I gonna do? They were playing our song. I can’t take this anymore.
Stuart, we have to talk. This thing with you and my mom, I hate it. It’s making me crazy. You and I were friends for years, and now you’re bringing my mother to a party I’m going to? What the hell?
Oh, so now you’re cheating on my mother?
Do you like her because you both have red hair?
Oh, my God.
That’s Jeanie.
Don’t say it.
She is my second cousin. We were 15, I just said, don’t say it.
Raj.
So, my mother’s okay with this?
‘Cause they have a weird, inappropriate relationship.
Why would you even come to this? Didn’t you know I’d be here?
Yeah.
Yeah.
Not until he stops humping his way up my family tree.
Rajj: It doesn’t bug you when they go out on dates?
Is this what I sound like when I talk about India?
Raj: And then went back to the home they share where they probably fell asleep in the matching pajamas she got them because they both just love penguins.

Oh, yeah, I got that Evite. Ever since I saw Pretty in Pink, I’ve wanted to go to an American prom. But then I saw Carrie, and I did not want to go to an American prom. But then I saw Never Been Kissed, and I’m back on the prom bandwagon. This prom thing’s been a real roller coaster.
Did you go to your prom?
How come you’re not shopping with Amy and Bernadette?
Ooh, I’ll, uh, text Stuart, let him know we’re close.
Hey, here comes Stuart and his date.
That’s Howard’s cousin that he had sex with.
It was our first date, there was an awkward silence. What was I supposed to say?
Okay. Here we go, say cheese. Iskip) Say cheese. Iskip) Say cousin. Iskip) Say…
Sheldon: You think you’ve got problems. The gibbon is the only member of the ape family not classified as a great ape.

All the non-human apes are classified as great apes except one. That means taxonomists created the entire category of lesser ape just to single out the poor gibbon as the weird kid on the playground. Now there’s a hairy little fellow with a genuine beef.
True. Sorry, kid, you’ve got it worse than a gibbon.

No. I had a date with a proper education. Instead of a tuxedo, I dressed myself in good habits. Instead of spiked punch, I enjoyed the intoxicating flavour of knowledge. Instead of dancing in a gym, I shook my bootyto the seductive rhythms…
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny?
Next time I might be in a rush, it’s good to have a few in the bank.
I’d like to discuss this party that Amy and Bernadette are throwing. Since you and I are both reluctant to go, I think I’ve come up with a perfect way for us to enjoy it.

We pretend we’re aliens. I’m not the best at reading facial cues, but I’m gonna say that you love it and want to hear more. Now, in the beloved novel Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy, an alien named Ford Prefect pretended to be human in order to blend in so that he could write an entry about Earth for The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy, which is a travel book within the actual book, which is also called The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy.

My point is, pretending to be an alien is a valuable coping mechanism I’ve used many times. I did it the first time I went to see you in a play. You had no idea Commander Umfrumf of Ceti Alpha Three was in the audience. Oh, don’t worry, he gave you seven thumbs up.
There are post-prom mating rituals?
Well, if it’s part of the prom experience, then I’m open to it.

I may be an alien, but I have urges. If Amy wants to copulate by firing her eggs into space, well, then, I will happily catch them with the reproductive sac on my upper flermin. I’m not the best at reading facial cues, but I can see that you’re a little turned on.
Bruce Wayne doesn’t wear a clip-on.
His name is Alfred, and, yes, he does.
What, are you sure? It’s my first prom, I want to do it correctly.
I was, but Penny didn’t want to. You didn’t want to. Bernadette, Amy, Koothrappali and Wolowitz didn’t want to. And even I knew it was weird to hire somebody.
Yes. I’ve decided to embrace all of the traditions associated with prom, including spiking the punch.
Oh, no, this is pomegranate juice. It’s all the fun of high school high jinks with the cell-protecting zip of antioxidants.
Oh, everything. Getting our picture taken, slow-dancing, being elected prom king. Pointing out that kings aren’t elected. It’s gonna be off the hook.
Why would you say that?
Penny implied the same thing. Is this true?
Thank you.
Excuse me.
I can’t do this. And for your information, Leonard, the upper flermin doesn’t grow between my shoulder blades, it grows out of the belly button on my neck.
I don’t think that’s a good idea.
According to an online message board, I may be having a panic attack. SoccerMom09 had similar symptoms. But to be fair, the twins were a real handful that day.
What’s going on is we’re about to go to a prom. And there’s a great deal of pressure on young couples like us to engage in what Mr. Bob Eubanks called making whoopee.
It’s not just that. Leonard and Penny also made comments about it. And I’m not blind. Even I looked twice when I saw my posterior in these tuxedo pants.
I really did think you looked pretty.
Yes. So much so that I started to panic.
Were you hoping we would because it’s prom?
Thank you for understanding.
I love you, too.

There’s no denying I have feelings for you that can’t be explained in any other way. I briefly considered that I had a brain parasite. But that seems even more farfetched. The only conclusion was love. I know what’s happening. This is a panic attack. SoccerMom09 says to lie down with your feet elevated.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Just because I love you doesn’t mean girls are allowed in my room.
Amy: Hi.
What’s with the clothes?
I meant why are they folded? But whatever. Ooh, what’s this?
Easy.
No, but I was on clean-up crew.
No, it was okay. The DJ let me dance one slow song with my mop before he shut down. Whenever I see a bucket of dirty water, I still hear Lady in Red.
Okay, we get it, you had a friend and a date. Stop bragging.
My date would’ve had to clean that up.
Oh, that would be so much fun. We could decorate the roof and make the guys wear tuxedos.
You went to seven proms?
Sheldon, you look so handsome.
What’s that?
Where are you going?
Sheldon, can I come in?
Why not?
You’re making me worry. What’s going on?
What pressure? All I said was you look handsome. Can you please open the door?
Sheldon, this is silly. I’m not missing another prom. I’m going upstairs now. Good-bye.
You did?
Well, you can relax. Just because you think I look pretty doesn’t mean we have to spend the night together.
I’m always hoping. But tonight I just wanted to have a nice time with you. And maybe dance with someone who has arms.

Of course I understand. Sheldon, there’s something else I’ve been wanting to say, but before I do, I just, I want you to know that you don’t have to say it back. I know you’re not ready, and I don’t want you to say it just because social convention dictates…
You said it.
Okay.
Penny: Hey.
Oh, great. I don’t suppose you also brought napkins, clean bowls, utensils and a roll of toilet paper.
Ah, You guys are the best.
Well, with all the new stuff I bought for work, I needed to make room in my closet.
That, believe it or not, is my prom dress.
What kind of teenager did you think I was?
The word is popular.
Aw, that’s sad.
Doesn’t matter. Prom is silly anyways.
No. I just made out with him a little while his date was puking.
Okay, guys, trust me, as someone who’s been to, like, seven proms, it is never as good as you want it to be.
Yeah, let’s see. Uh, four Under the Seas, two Enchanted Evenings, and one Night to Remember that I cannot remember for the life of me.
Okay, okay.
Well, who cares what I think? What do you think?
Ugh, thanks a lot.
Well, now I can’t blow this thing off without being a bitch.
You knocked more than usual.
Okay, what’s up?
Great, how?
Okay, just one question. What?
Here’s a question, as an alien pretending to be human, are you planning to engage in any post-prom mating rituals with Amy?
Not always. Unless your date drives a van with an air mattress, then always.
You’re kidding.
Thank you, so do you.
Sheldon, doesn’t Amy look hot? That’s got to put some starch in the upper flermin.
Oh, it’s beautiful.
Aw, I know I wasn’t into this before, but I’m so glad I get to take you to your first prom.
Well, who’d you go with?
Aw.
Well, if I would have been there and saw you alone, I would’ve asked you to dance.
Well, you don’t know that.
What, that already happened?
Well, you wouldn’t have asked me either.
Well, I might not have asked you to dance then, but I will ask you now.
I don’t care. We’ll make our own music.
Thank you for wearing your heels.
Want to take a picture of us and send it to your old friends in the chess club?
I know, me, too. But it will be fun to have a prom without all the drama.
Bernadette: We brought snacks for movie night.
Right here.
Wow, you still have it? I just assumed it was balled up in the corner of a barn somewhere.
Slutty.
How was your prom? Did you go?
My prom was pretty terrible, too. I was so excited about my date, but it turned out he only asked me ’cause he liked my friend. He spent the whole night talking about her.
Ooh, I have an idea. Maybe we can have, like, a prom do-over.
Ooh, and get our hair done, and slow-dance.
Ooh, every single person RSVP’d yes. This is so exciting. Isn’t this exciting?
Look, even Stuart’s bringing a date. I wonder who it is.
Because he’s our friend, and you two need to get along. And why can’t he take your mom? You took her to your prom.
I saw a picture of you two dancing together.
That’s a neat tattoo.
Aw, that movie’s so cute.
I like Cinderella.
I like Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo.
What?
That’s Jeanie?
So, you knew and you brought her anyway?
Yeah, go have weird relationships with your own mother and cousin. This is his turf.
Howie, get off of him.
Bernadette: Easy for you to say: you probably went with the captain of the football team.
Stuart: I’m not bringing your mother, I have a date.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. What are you talking about? There’s nothing weird going on with me and your mother.
So, I met Jeanie at your Aunt Gladys’. She passed me the Manischewitz, I took one look at this punim, and I almost plotzed on the kugel.
And you’re only second cousins, who cares?
Oh, so she’s good enough for Howard, but not for me?
Oh, sorry. Hang on, sorry. (On phone) Hey, Debbie. I, yeah, yeah, I’m here with Jeanie. Okay, but we’re just friends. It’s, yeah. I got to go.
Mrs Wolowitz (off): Stewie, your bath is getting cold!
Emily: Oh, thanks, it’s Sally from Nightmare before Christmas.
Uh, a little, but more that she’s covered in scars and can pull her own limbs off and sew them back on.
Did you know, in the original book, the sisters cut off their toes with knives in order to fit in the glass slipper?
No, it’s okay. He told me that story a long time ago.
I know, I’m having the best time.
Jeannie: Why would your mother have a problem with me and Stuart?
Weirder than what you and I did in my dad’s Corolla?
It was a long time ago, Howard.
